header_summary: In recent discussions, Steven Roose introduces the concept of a TxHash and its formalization in a Bitcoin Improvement Proposal (BIP). The BIP defines a TxFieldSelector for selecting data within a transaction and introduces new opcodes. The proposal addresses concerns about resource usage and mentions potential caching strategies. Johan Torås Halseth discusses the implementation of the MATT challenge protocol using OP_CHECKCONTRACTVERIFY and OP_CAT opcodes. The email provides a link to a detailed write-up for more information. Antoine Riard discusses the concept of OP_EVICT in an off-chain payment pool and expresses the need for covenant flexibility and possible solutions.

recent_posts.title: Draft BIP: OP_TXHASH and OP_CHECKTXHASHVERIFY
recent_posts.summary:
- Steven Roose has developed a BIP that formalizes the concept of a TxHash.
- The BIP introduces a TxFieldSelector to select data within a transaction.
- The proposal addresses resource usage concerns and seeks general feedback and community interest.

recent_posts.title: MATT: [demo] Optimistic execution of arbitrary programs
recent_posts.summary:
- The email discusses the implementation of the original MATT challenge protocol.
- A detailed write-up provides instructions on transforming a program for verification on-chain.
- The implementation utilizes opcodes OP_CHECKCONTRACTVERIFY and OP_CAT to challenge computation in transactions.

recent_posts.title: Solving CoinPool high-interactivity issue with cut-through update of Taproot leaves
recent_posts.summary:
- Antoine Riard discusses OP_EVICT in the context of an off-chain payment pool.
- He raises concerns about OP_EVICT's safety and proposes solutions like TLUV or MERKLESUB.
- Antoine questions the best direction to solve the high interactivity issue of payment pools.

recent_posts.title: Payment Splitting & Switching and its impact on Balance Discovery Attacks (preprint)
recent_posts.summary:
- Tony Giorgio and Gijs van Dam discuss the concept of decorrelated payments.
- Gijs suggests that the concept can help with analyzed decorrelated payments.
- Gijs refers Tony to a research write-up from last year for more information.

recent_posts.title: Announcing the Lightning Network Interoperability Initiative
recent_posts.summary:
- Vincenzo Palazzo acknowledges an error in his previous post and provides the correct link.
- Vincent apologizes for any confusion caused by the mistake in his previous post.
- The correct link is not mentioned in the email, but Vincent provided it in a previous post.

recent_posts.title: Sidepools For Improving Payment Reliability At Scale
recent_posts.summary:
- ZmnSCPxj discusses the implementation of a sidepool using the Decker-Wattenhofer mechanism.
- The implementation involves considering the number of stages, steps per stage, and blocks per step.
- Sidepools provide a settlement layer on top of the blockchain layer for balancing channels.

active_posts.title: Concern about "Inscriptions"
active_posts.summary:
- In a worst-case scenario, blockchain growth would amount to 210.24GB per year.
- A 5TB hard drive costing less than $150 would provide storage for 21 years.
- Ongoing optimization efforts and affordable hardware make blockchain storage sufficient for practical usage.

active_posts.title: Scaling Lightning With Simple Covenants
active_posts.summary:
- The email proposes using covenant-based protocols to scale Lightning channels for casual users.
- Simple covenants and timeout-trees can eliminate the bottleneck of obtaining signatures from users.
- Off-chain transactions and covenants can greatly improve the scalability of Lightning as a payment method.

active_posts.title: Concrete MATT opcodes
active_posts.summary:
- Salvatore Ingala presented a complete proposal for the core opcodes of MATT.
- The proposal includes an improved implementation and introduces a new opcode, OP_CHECKCONTRACTVERIFY.
- The new opcode allows for the full generality of MATT and fraud proofs.

active_posts.title: Scaling Lightning With Simple Covenants
active_posts.summary:
- The email discusses scaling Lightning and proposes solutions to create Lightning channels for casual users.
- Enabling simple covenants and timeout-trees can greatly improve Lightning's scalability.
- These protocols allow for off-chain transactions, multiple channels per user, and address usability concerns.

active_posts.title: Remotely control your lightning node from your favorite HSM
active_posts.summary:
- Bastien has submitted a pull request for a simple architecture to securely send admin commands.
- The architecture uses a hardware security module acting as a whitelisted lightning peer.
- Minimal changes to the lightning node are needed, and Bastien offers to contribute to development.

active_posts.title: Practical PTLCs, a little more concretely
active_posts.summary:
- Greg discusses the importance of paying attention to PTLCs as taproot channels are being deployed.
- He has shared a detailed gist on GitHub, examining factors like single-sig adaptors and message re-ordering.
- Greg suggests that his information on PTLCs can lead to discussions and potential standardization efforts.
